review:
[b]PROS[/b]

- Reddit Lucio

[b]CONS[/b]

- Open the game, you get assaulted by the UI begging you to pay, PAY, PAY!!
- Enter a match, you get assaulted by Brits looking for a smoke
- Unlock everything, tens of different progressions, get a shiny ding-ding for being able to breath or owning a mouse, but you should pay to get even more
- More currencies than Europe in 1995!
- A gameplay loop so compelling you should pay to avoid it 
- FOMO, FOMO everywhere
- PVE content is atrocious, but still, you should pay for it. Hero kits are not designed for meaningful PvE, big parts of their kits feel useless or even detrimental. There should be a separate progression to unlock specific skills (oh, yes. It got scrapped)

I bought OW1 years ago and had some fun, nothing to write home about but at least I've got my money's worth (I paid around 20$ iirc). I'll probably play again because the gameplay loop is the same and can be fun sometimes, but everything else in this free upgrade (you should pay for) is a big, big, big mistake

game was free and i want a refund
Play Dave the diver instead.

I wanted to leave a realistic review on here, as someone who has played a large amount of hours on OW1 and has just picked up OW2, as most of the reviews here are focused solely on review bombing.

Gameplay wise, in my opinion, the game is better than OW1.  Old-heads will complain about the new 5v5 gameplay, however, I believe it adds much more strategy and allows for more swinging gameplay than the old system did.  By taking the double shield meta away, and by shifting away from having to chew through tanks every game, I believe it creates a more fast paced, streamlined game.  Additionally, the new hero balancing, has been pretty positive imo, again, removing most shields just makes the gameplay more exciting.  So, overall, I think the gameplay is in a much better state than it was previously.

The negatives are obviously the new monetization model.  They had a perfect set up in OW1, giving free loot boxes as you leveled, while you could also purchase them if you wanted to.  The new system is terrible, and the skins are obscenely expensive for what you get in return, so I would not purchase them.  It seems to me that people simply overlook the fact that you do not have to purchase these terribly overpriced products.  Given this is a huge negative, as it is optional, I see no reason to hold that against the gameplay itself.  

Overall, I am giving this a recommendation due to the gameplay.  The monetization needs work and is clearly disliked by many, including myself, and OW would still be making more than enough money through the old lootbox method, even if they kept the battlepass along with it.  However, in my opinion, the gameplay outweighs the terrible monetization as again, it is OPTIONAL.  I hope the move to steam and this Blizzard transition, will help the game get to a better place monetization-wise, but I wont hold my breath.

For now, if you want to try the game try it and decide for yourself!  The review bombing only tells half the story.

none of these reviews are actually about the gameplay. its a good game, and mostly always has been. people are pissed over pve, and im sad to have to tell you that if you ever expected overwatch pve to be the thing to make you want to play the game, you were there for the wrong reasons from the start. and the cosmetics do not matter for shit lmao, "overpriced skins" etc is just a stupid point to bring the game down, honestly, its just cosmetics, it doesnt affect the gameplay, it doesnt make the game any less fun. at the end of the day, overwatch is an excellent pvp game, and has depth for new and veteran players. sure people have a right to be upset, but saying that cosmetics and the cancellation of a secondary gamemode ruins the gameplay experience is ridiculous. please grow up

It's not as bad as people claim it to be, unlike TF2 and other TPS and FPS games, it actually works, it doesn't lag, I wouldn't say it's thought through and balanced but it's not as bad as people claim it to be, however, although I played a match and I won, I have to admit I didn't have fun, the experience is bland, was that different before? I don't know because I never played Overwatch before. But since literally everything else sucks and Battlefield and COD cost a kidney and don't function properly, this may just be one of the very, very few FPS games that people can swarm to. But devs seriously need to work on the fun element, I don't think I've played too many games that are joyless, but this is one of them. Granted, I'm writing this after just one played match, but if I encounter issues, I'll update the review

This game is terrible
 The case when P*rnhub works more for the game than the developers for the players. Just be aware that this is a game where you will be sold a skin along the way for 20 bucks. A skin that you don't see in 95% of the gameplay due to the FPS genre of the game. Blizzard's greed knows no bounds.

After 7 years, the developers released a "story" addition, which turned out to be simple combat events with the shooting of omnics

Oh Yes, Never Play Ranked in this "game".
Overwatch is a toxic cesspool that the developers, not the players, are to blame for

No new content, bad matchmaking , odd balance settings, and the presence of traits such as Widowmaker and Sombra in the game roster - difficult characters, but usually liked by various sexaholics, who want to require Widowmaker's ass, not winning the game.

This was my favourite game since release until it got abandoned by the developers.
Everything after the re-release is just sad.
Blizzard could use Overwatch as a guide how to alienate an entire community.

First off, ranking system is absolutely dog. No more SR, 6v6, etc. They could have limited shields in some way to make it not as overwhelming, but they decided to completely gut 6v6 all together without fixing the core issues. Everything is behind a paywall including characters, cosmetics, battle pass, etc. No more lootbox system. Everything is overpriced.

The sexual harassment/assault history of the company is also very troubling. Blizzard has shown itself to be an unsafe place for women gamers/game developers. Hiding the whole original vision of PvE from the community and to cancel it was also very scummy, causing a major uproar. Pro players are leaving the scene in droves, as well as veteran players who have been around since the beginning. 

These negative reviews are very accurate. Listen to them. Stay clear. They don't care about the player experience anymore. They are focused on money and preying on innocent people. If you play for your own personal enjoyment, that is fine and dandy. You're allowed to play what you want to play. But please don't give a dime of your money to these greedy turds who are destroying everything.
2??? 2 wipes of my ass is more enjoyable than this trash
